instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.U7501: What is U7501? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V3_S5,  PP3V3_S3,  PP3V3_S0,  PP5V_S5,  PP5V_S4,  PP5V_S0.
definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .
definitions.PP5V_S4: What is PP5V_S4? PP5V_S4 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.SMC_PM_G2_EN: What is SMC_PM_G2_EN? SMC_PM_G2_EN is a signal that comes from the SMC that is a prerequsite for all of the enable signals for the S5 rails to come on, such as P3V3S5_EN. S5 rails will not come on if SMC_PM_G2_EN is not coming..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green/Orange light, Not turning on, Corrosion around <CHIP>U7501</CHIP>
threads.message:
Hey everyone,

I have a slightly liquid damaged board which initially had no light but there was corrosion around <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> so I replaced the the chip and also changed capacitors <CAPACITOR>C7500</CAPACITOR> (one pad was completely destroyed so made a jumper going to Pin 23 of <CHIP>U7501</CHIP>) and <CAPACITOR>C7503</CAPACITOR>. No I have a green which now turns to orange light but still not powering on and nothing warms up either.
[TABLE="border: 0, cellpadding: 0, cellspacing: 0"]
[TR]
[TD="width: 220"]<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>[/TD]
 			[TD="width: 147"]12.56V[/TD]
 		[/TR]
[TR]
[TD]<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>[/TD]
 			[TD]16.41V[/TD]
 		[/TR]
[TR]
[TD]<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>[/TD]
 			[TD]3.42V[/TD]
 		[/TR]
[TR]
[TD]<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3J</SIGNAL>[/TD]
 			[TD]3.42V[/TD]
 		[/TR]
[TR]
[TD]<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>[/TD]
 			[TD]1.7001V[/TD]
 		[/TR]
[TR]
[TD]<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL>[/TD]
 			[TD]0V[/TD]
 		[/TR]
[TR]
[TD]<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL>[/TD]
 			[TD]0V[/TD]
 		[/TR]
[TR]
[TD]<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL>[/TD]
 			[TD]0V[/TD]
 		[/TR]
[TR]
[TD]<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S3</SIGNAL>[/TD]
 			[TD]0V[/TD]
 		[/TR]
[TR]
[TD]<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>[/TD]
 			[TD]3.29V[/TD]
 		[/TR]
[/TABLE]


I'm basically getting no 5V (besides 1.7 on S5) and no 3V3 RailsThese are some of my readings and I have checked all the rails but nothing else looks damaged and not sure where to go from here.

Many thanks for any help.
Sam

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green/Orange light, Not turning on, Corrosion around <CHIP>U7501</CHIP>
threads.message:
Is trackpad disconnected?
Check <CAPACITOR>C7505</CAPACITOR> and <CAPACITOR>C4807</CAPACITOR> too.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green/Orange light, Not turning on, Corrosion around <CHIP>U7501</CHIP>
threads.message:
Double check if pin 23 is actually making contact with the chip as it usually is destroyed. 

<SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL> present?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green/Orange light, Not turning on, Corrosion around <CHIP>U7501</CHIP>
threads.message:
Everything but fan and dc board connected.
Both capacitors giving the same voltages (1.7V) and looks fine.

Won't be able to check Pin 23 since I am doing this at home and microscope is at the workshop. But it seems good as there is continuity.

<SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL> is present with 3.4V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green/Orange light, Not turning on, Corrosion around <CHIP>U7501</CHIP>
threads.message:
"Both capacitors giving the same voltages (1.7V) and looks fine"
Already knew that...
I asked to remove them and see if voltage rise.
Don't you imagine better method to check components than the eye???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green/Orange light, Not turning on, Corrosion around <CHIP>U7501</CHIP>
threads.message: I would first confirm pin 23 actually has 12.6V on it before doing anything else.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green/Orange light, Not turning on, Corrosion around <CHIP>U7501</CHIP>
threads.message:
Quadruple checked Pin 23 and its only giving 0.6V and changes everytime i make an adjustment to the jumper (goes up to 1.5V)

Removing either capacitors does nothing to the voltages
